H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H6810.def: literally: small; hence: = state in which humans are considered unworthy of honor and respect

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H3611.def: = relatively small light brown domestic animal, feeding on anything from household refuse to animal carcasses and excreta; ◄ |iCanis familiaris putiatini|i*; ► extremely unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten, though used for hunting and for watching sheep; ≈ considered almost as unclean as a {L:pig<SDBH:חֲזִיר>}; associated with all sorts of uncleanness, aggression, greediness, low status; used as derogatory term for male shrine prostitutes

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3624.def: = state in which humans are healthy and strong

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H1565.def: = state in which humans are unable to conceive a child

H2639.def: = state in which humans are in lack of something that they are supposed to have; ≈ associated with hardship

H3720.def: = condition of not having food to eat

H6723.def: = state in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert-like conditions

H4875.def: = state in which buildings and infrastructure have been totally destroyed

H570.def: = time of day when it becomes dark

H6998.def: = causative action by which humans remove leaves, branches, fruits, or the entire stalk of a plant

H4408.def: = meaning unsure; possibly: a plant which grows up to 2 m tall; its stem and branches have small silver-gray leaves covered with tiny hairs; it is found in abundance in salty areas in the desert and on the shores of the Mediterranean Sea and the Dead Sea; ◄ Atriplex halimus (shrubby orache); ► the leaves are edible, though salty

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H7574.def: = a tough desert shrub, up to 2 m tall, with many small branches, few leaves, and clusters of white flowers; ◄ Retama raetam; ► provides some shade in the desert, and its roots contain oil and so make a very hot fire

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H1644.def: = process by which large bodies of water move back and forth as a result of natural forces

H1460.def: = the rear part of the human body, especially from the neck to the bottom

H1590.def: = human who secretly takes possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H3710.def: = piece of stone of relatively large size; ◄ found in nature ► used as hiding place

H2356.def: = empty, open place ◄ in a solid body

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H5101.def: = action by which humans and animals produce a loud, harsh cry

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H2738.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = plant with thorns or another desert shrub, like nettle (|iUrtica dioica|i* or |iUrtica pilulifera|i*); ► useless; ≈ symbol of uncultivated areas

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H5217.def: = causative action by which humans force other humans to leave a certain place

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H5058.def: = musical instrument with strings, such as a {L:lute<SDBH:כִּנֹּור>} or {L:lyre<SDBH:נֵבֶל>}

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H7536.def: = a watery liquid in the mouth, helping with chewing and swallowing; ≈ sometimes spit out in the direction of other people as an expression of disgust

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H3499.def: = what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H7448.def: = set of ropes or leather straps; ► fitted over the head of a horse and connected to the {L:bit<SDBH:מֶתֶג>}; used to steer the horse

6.gl: to loosen (someone's bowstring) > to render (someone) weak, vulnerable

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5549.def: literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans create a road or access ramp by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H5420.def: literally: to break down (someone's) path; hence: = causative action by which human make someone else's life impossible as if it were a road that had been made impassable

H3276.def: = process by which someone's well-being is promoted by a certain action or event

H1942.def: = state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H857.def: = to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective

H7342.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H6556.def: = large hole in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► made with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

H1556.def: = causative action by which humans cause an object to move by turning it over and over

H1091.def: = something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H5082.def: = state in which humans are respected and their position in the community is secure

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H5645.def: = mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H5365.def: exact meaning unsure; literally: to dig out: = causative action by which a condition inflicts an excruciating pain on someone's body (literally: bones)

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H2664.def: = action by which humans carefully examine a place in order to find people or objects located in it or in order to gain information about it

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H247.def: = to wear a belt or girdle around one's waist

H3801.def: = an undergarment, ◄ woven of linen, ► and worn by the High Priest and his fellow priests; it was worn over the {L:breeches<SDBH:מִכְנָס>}, but from the waist up it was next to the skin; it was a kind of shirt and probably had long sleeves and reached nearly to the ankles and was held in place by a sash wound around the waist.

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H665.def: = powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H393.def: = pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals

H7852.def: = state in which humans harbor resentment against (other) humans for things they did in the past

H6108.def: = the framework of bones supporting the human body

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H7392.def: = action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} or a {L:horse<SDBH:סוּס>} or in a {L:chariot<SDBH:מֶרְכָּבָה>}

H4127.def: = process by which a relatively hard object becomes softer

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4150.def: = an action by which two or more parties come together for a particular purpose

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5856.def: = heap of stones ◄ remaining after the total destruction of a town; ≈ associated with hardship and poverty

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7769.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H7186.def: = state in which an object is firm and stable in shape

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5701.def: exact meaning unsure: = process by which humans experience an emotion of grief for someone else and/or express this feeling by weeping

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H652.def: = state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death

H7570.def: = causative action by which humans bring water to a temperature in which it starts bubbling

H4578.def: literally =  the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H6923.def: = action by which humans place themselves in front of individuals or groups, facing either forward or backward, ► and either with good or with evil intentions; ≈ sometimes used figuratively in situations where humans come before God in worship, or where God confronts enemies, or when certain conditions are personified

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6937.def: = process by which an object becomes dark in color

H2535.def: = state in which the sun produces an extremely high temperature

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3284.def: exact meaning unknown; probably: = a type of owl, large, standing over 75 centimeters (30 inches) tall; it has a pale fawn color, is spotted, has ear tufts, and is best known by its loud, deep hooting at night; it roosts by day in deep shade in acacia trees, caves, tombs, and ruined buildings; it feeds on small mammals, including hares, baby gazelles, lambs, rats and mice, and large roosting birds, especially wild and domestic ducks; ◄ Bubo bubo; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

H5785.def: = the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

H7835.def: = process by which the color of an object turns darker until it is (almost) black

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H2721.def: = state in which an object is free from moisture or liquid

H3658.def: = musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

H60.def: = a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H5748.def: = wood-wind instrument; ≈ its music is associated with joy and well-being

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
